alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 10 at 1:40PM PST until February 12 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM SATURDAY TO 3 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...From 9 AM Saturday to 3 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will build to advisory levels Saturday morning, peak Saturday and Saturday night, then subside Sunday. Surf will be highest on northwest facing beaches. Another round of high surf, possibly even larger, is expected early net week.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
